intro: Eriogonum diclinum, commonly known as the two-leaved buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive leaf structure. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often opposite and have a rough texture, while the flowers are usually pink or reddish in color. Eriogonum diclinum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is a common sight in sagebrush ecosystems.
